definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: A change in emphasis will be essential.
sentences.chinese: 側重點的改變至關重要。

sentences.english: Nowadays its keystone is to treat the police with true feelings.
sentences.chinese: 現階段從優待警的側重點是以情待警。

sentences.english: The developing direction and major project of biopesticides in China were suggested in the paper as well.
sentences.chinese: 並提出了我國發展生物農藥的方向和側重點。

sentences.english: Additionally, both have taken on different positions in the definition of monitoring.
sentences.chinese: 此外，兩者對監視的定義也採取了不同的側重點。

sentences.english: Each interviewer will have an area of focus.
sentences.chinese: 每個面試官都會有一個側重點。

sentences.english: I think that's the wrong emphasis, frankly.
sentences.chinese: 坦率地說，我認爲這個側重點是錯誤的。
